page.title: 13VILLAGE STUDY-EATON.
page.content: THE COLLEGE CLOSED IN 1980 AS A RESULT OF A CUTBACK IN EDUCATION SPENDING.THE COLLEGE WAS LATER RE-OPENED AS EATON HALL INTERNATIONAL,A LANGUAGE SCHOOL FOR FOREIGN STUDENTS.NOW WE CAN SEE PEOPLE OF MANY DIFFERENT RACES WALKING ABOUT THE TOWN WHO ATTEND THE COLLEGE TO LEARN ENGLISH.IT IS INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT MR.E.L.ABLESON A PRINCIPAL AT THE COLLEGE FROM 1962 TO 1972 TOLD US THAT IT STANDS WHERE THE OLD MANOR HOUSE OF THE VILLAGE HAS STOOD SINCE THE FIRST{DOMESDAY BOOK}WAS WRITTEN AND THAT THE GROUNDS HAVE CHANGED VERY LITTLE IN EXTENT SINCE 1326. {DWELLINGS}IN 1871 THERE WERE FOURTY SEVEN DWELLINGS IN THE VILLAGE OF EATON,TODAY WE COUNTED THIRTY.THIS IS BECAUSE MANY OF THE OLDER COTTAGES HAVE BEEN KNOCKED INTO ONE TO FORM LARGER DWELLING HOUSES.
